Detailed Description

Animations are sequences of images and the logic needed to know when, where, and how to display them.

Every animation is tied to a single polygon for collision detection. Animations may loop, may change the location of the animated object after completing, and may have specialized logic for when to change animation frames.

  updateFunc,

Create a new Animation instance.

def animation.Animation.completeAnimation (   self,
  owner 
)

Our owner calls this if the animation is complete; we update its state as necessary now.

Currently that just means applying self.moveOffset

def animation.Animation.draw (   self,
  screen,
  camera,
  loc,
  scale = 1 
)

Draw the animation to screen, taking self.drawOffset into account.

def animation.Animation.reset (   self  ) 

Reset internal state so the animation can be cleanly re-run.

def animation.Animation.update (   self,
  owner 
)

Advance self.frames.

If self.updateFunc is specified, use that; otherwise, use self.updateRate. Return True if the animation is complete, False otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

animation.Animation.drawOffset

A positional offset used when drawing.

animation.Animation.frame

Current frame of animation; an index into self.frames.

animation.Animation.frames

Individual frames of the animation.

animation.Animation.group

The collection of animations that this one is a part of.

For example, in "player/run-l" the group would be "player"

animation.Animation.isComplete

Tracks if we've reached the end of the animation.

animation.Animation.moveOffset

The amount to move the animated object after the animation completes.

This value is never used if the animation is set to loop, as the animation never completes.

animation.Animation.name

The specific animation name, e.g.

"run-l"

animation.Animation.polygon

The polygon that is used for all frames of the animation.

animation.Animation.shouldLoop

If true, the animation will automatically loop when it runs out of frames, and will therefore never complete.

If false, then once the final frame is reached, the animation will stay on that frame indefinitely.

animation.Animation.updateFunc

If this is not None, then it specifies a function that accepts the object being animated and returns the number of frames to advace the animation.

animation.Animation.updateRate

If this is not None, then it specifies how rapidly animation frames update in terms of physics updates (1 => 1 frame advanced per physics update).
